description:
Estimate response function coefficients based on the DWI signal in single-fibre voxels.

This command uses the image data from all selected single-fibre voxels concurrently, rather than simply averaging their individual spherical harmonic coefficients. It also ensures that the response function is non-negative, and monotonic (i.e. its amplitude must increase from the fibre direction out to the orthogonal plane).

If multi-shell data are provided, and one or more b-value shells are not explicitly requested, the command will generate a response function for every b-value shell (including b=0 if present).

References:

Smith, R. E.; Dhollander, T. & Connelly, A. Constrained linear least squares estimation of anisotropic response function for spherical deconvolution. ISMRM Workshop on Breaking the Barriers of Diffusion MRI, 23.

isotropic.title: isotropic
isotropic.description: estimate an isotropic response function (lmax=0 for all shells)

noconstraint.title: noconstraint
noconstraint.description: disable the non-negativity and monotonicity constraints

directions.title: directions
directions.description: provide an external text file containing the directions along which the amplitudes are sampled

shells.title: shells
shells.description:
specify one or more b-values to use during processing, as a comma-separated list of the desired approximate b-values (b-values are clustered to allow for small deviations). Note that some commands are incompatible with multiple b-values, and will report an error if more than one b-value is provided. 
WARNING: note that, even though the b=0 volumes are never referred to as shells in the literature, they still have to be explicitly included in the list of b-values as provided to the -shell option! Several algorithms which include the b=0 volumes in their computations may otherwise return an undesired result.

lmax.title: lmax
lmax.description: specify the maximum harmonic degree of the response function to estimate (can be a comma-separated list for multi-shell data)

quiet.title: quiet
quiet.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

force.title: force
force.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

nthreads.title: nthreads
nthreads.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

key.title: key
key.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

value.title: value
value.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

items.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

config.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

help.title: help
help.description: display this information page and exit.

mask.title: mask
mask.description: the mask containing the voxels from which to estimate the response function

directions_1.title: directions
directions_1.description: a 4D image containing the estimated fibre directions

response.title: response
response.description: the output zonal spherical harmonic coefficients
